website_summaries.verdict: Best option for a growing family because it can affordably accommodate all ages.
pros: Standing position in the back of the stroller is perfect for your toddler
Reclining option is great for sleeping babies
Parking brake only takes a light tap of the foot
cons: Does not come with room for three children to sit

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but grwat
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stroller, but keep in mind it has to be put together and it is EXTREMELY heavy. You will need a lot of space to take it anywhere in your car. My daughter-in-law loves it, but she cannot lift it alone. So it's great to keep in your garage and take the kids for a walk. But to go anywhere you might need a large vehicle and some help getting it in and out. Great design though. My toddler grandson loves to stand up. It came on time with all pieces. Overall a good investment as long as you know what a beast it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna B.

customer_reviews.title: I still love it ;)
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for 5 mos now and it is very helpful with our twins and 2 yr old. The heavier they get the harder it is to steer unless you are on even smooth surface. Pulling it makes it easier to steer when possible. and it barely fit in our 07 odyssey
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it fits in your vehicle.
customer_reviews.text: We own a Nissan Quest. We're worried that it might not fit but it does. Not flat but at an angle without all trays and canopies. It's perfect for our growing family. Even bought the attachment seat for a third child. It is a bit HUGE... wish the handle bar was movable so I could lower it. Can't complain too much it's not very easy to find a triple stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Soozie Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Very Unsatisfied
customer_reviews.text: I brought this as a gift for my Niece, who has a 2 yr old, 1 yr and a month old baby, It's not as described she has tried 2 different car seat the don't attach securely . The back part where a child can stand is ok but can be a little more steady. Good for moving in forward and back ward position but had to maneuver when turn. The snack tray and sun visor is very hard to removed and visor is small. Very little leg room for the her baby sitting in the back seat portion. Very disappointed in this purchase, especially since it was a gift
customer_reviews.author: oona Garrette

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken but they sent a replacement!
customer_reviews.text: Good stroller but arrived with a broken piece, I contacted the company and sent my purchase information and they quickly sent an entire new stroller since the broken piece was attached to the main frame. It has been great to have the other parts from the older stroller for replacement. The stroller is heavy/bulky which is expected from a 3 kid stroller and it drives like a bus but having my 3 under 3 contained is priceless! It can be challenging to turn but it is sturdy, well-made, and open and closes easily. It fits in our minivan if we have 1/2 of the backseat folded down as it is quite long.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Rapkiewcz

customer_reviews.title: Think twice before getting this stroller
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is very awkward because of its length. It does not maneuver easily. It would be very easy for this stroller to tip over. The third seat intended for an older toddler slides and does not lock in place making it very difficult for a child to sit on it. The seat back of the top seat leans back to accommodate an infant carrier but this makes it very uncomfortable for the child sitting on the third seat. Folded up this stroller does not fit in the back of my car, a Honda Pilot, unless angled into the back seat with the 3rd row down. It would not fit into a mini van. This is a big problem!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Landrum

customer_reviews.title: Huge but good.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is truly huge. Only fits I. The back of my minivan if I take the front tray and sunshade off. Rides smoothly, is great for flat trails and sidewalks. Can fit next to tables in fast food places (Instead of high chairs). My kids love to ride in it, the straps are a little tough to adjust. Only issues, if you put a heavier child in the front it’s difficult to maneuver and, while the bottom basket can hold a lot there is no good way to get things into it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel S.

customer_reviews.title: Better to pass on.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and was excited to get it. However the seats are very narrow and the foot rests are angled downward so kids feet can't stay on them, they slide off. My kids spend the whole time trying to stay in the seats. The wheels are plastic not rubber so that makes it hard to maneuver. The stroller is longer than a normal two seater, so this makes it hard to control. I have carpal tunnel and I have a very hard and painful time pushing this because it always wants to go sideways. It looks nice, but is a cheeply made stroller and wish I hadn't gotten it.
customer_reviews.author: Army wife2012

customer_reviews.title: And I feel very happy to be able to give it to her
customer_reviews.text: This was for a single young mother with three kids. It is so well constructed that I know she will be able to use it for a long time. And I feel very happy to be able to give it to her.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetie irf

customer_reviews.title: Veers left
customer_reviews.text: I purchased early in my pregnancy for 2 y/o twins and new singleton on the way, now that baby is here we tried it out and it veers off to the left making it hard to push, steer, and overall makes this non functional. So disappointed. Past the allowed time to return with amazon but I think I will call to see if they are willing to accept it anyhow. :/ high hopes sunk into this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Momma-shopper

customer_reviews.title: Not amazing
customer_reviews.text: Kids can't lean back very far, the foot rests don't really work for older kids, and the sit/stand seat is terrible for sitting. With all that said, we've loved having this beast. It does not fit into the trunk of our van, which is ridiculous, but it's got great storage. I think I would have wanted something different, but since we bought this for so much money, we're content with what we have.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: Great Stroller
customer_reviews.text: I have a three year old, one year old, and a two month old. I love this stroller. My oldest can walk but she still gets tired so it gives her a place to sit. The trays and car seat adjuster are easy to take off and put on. It is very big, not for stores with small aisles. I don’t think it would fit in an elevator. Also you probably need at least a minivan to fit it in your vehicle. With three kids this stroller is a lifesaver, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Eliza Davis

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE this stroller!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love it. I purchased this for my 3 granddaughters, ages 6 mos, 2 yrs and 3 yrs. It is perfect for them. There is plenty of space for each one of them, drink holders on the sides of the seats and plenty of storage under it. It comes with 2 attachments for the infant car seats. The biggest downfall is the length, which is understandable since it seats 3. I struggle to get it in the back of my Dodge Grand Caravan.
customer_reviews.author: carla

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this, dangerous to turn. Stroller wants to topple over
customer_reviews.text: Hard to turn, kids almost fell over. Imagine driving a big rig. That’s what this stroller felt like. Ended up keeping our double and buying a single. We both push strollers.
customer_reviews.author: JHN

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy, great quality
customer_reviews.text: As a mom of a 2 month old, 2 yr old, and 3.5 yr old, I adore this. Extremely sturdy, great quality, very versatile, and very light for being metal. It's pretty long but moves very smooth and easy. Only downside is it folds up very flat, but very long. It barely fits in my rav4, which has a very big trunk. But it is a life saver for us and I would 100% recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Sheckell

customer_reviews.title: Nice stroller but huge!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good stroller but does not fit well in any vehicle other than pick up trucks and minivans. Will only fit in the mini van if all removable items are detached. If this would have fit in my car, I think I would have loved this stroller but since I couldn't get it to sold up and fit car, I rated this low. Great if you have e 3 younger children but not great if you cant get it to fit to use it
customer_reviews.author: Melodee H.

customer_reviews.title: Like a train
customer_reviews.text: Very long even when folded. The back seat and parent cup holder comes separate even though its over $200. Had to upgrade car to fit 3 car seats and caught heck trying to find a car with a big enough trunk for this beast. Is hard to lift and turn. Without someone with me to unload it, I might not even bother. Now these struggles may just be the way it is going from 1 to 3 babes so meh..
customer_reviews.author: rah5m

customer_reviews.title: so heavy and so huge
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted a Graco DuoGlider but they were unavailable at the time, and we had a Joovy Caboose in the past so we went with this. It's so huge, barely fits in the big trunk of our Sienna. It's difficult to remove the bars that hold up the car seats. The lowest shoulder setting is too high for my 9-month old babies (18lbs).
customer_reviews.author: H. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Love.  Love.  Love.
customer_reviews.text: Love this! This is an absolute breeze to maneuver. Very light weight frame. Easy steering. I can easily steer this with one arm while pulling a grocery cart behind me. With my twins and my 3 yr old in it. The baby in the middle seat does kick the back of the baby in the front. This is the only downside I can see but I don't think this is the fault of the stroller, but the age of the children (18 mo).
customer_reviews.author: cs

customer_reviews.title: product  quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in February, waited one month to remove from box as weather was too cold to use outdoors. After three uses with twins and a toddler the front wheel fell off and could not be put back on. Contacted Amazon who offered at first replacement parts but after some discussion replaced the defective stroller. Hopefully my grandchildren will not be harmed with the new one. Bough the advertised protection plan this time for a two year term.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo DiGiovanni

customer_reviews.title: Horrible turning and control
customer_reviews.text: Had a major flaw. It is very hard to turn. Three handle bars ate to close together. My wife can barely control it in a crowded area. We bought for zoo and if there is any angle or slope to the side it is impossible to keep it straight.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good for when it’s just me and the twins and my 2 year old when out and about - and for the family trips to the zoo, mall and doctor visits- as my kiddos get bigger I know it will be difficult trying to maneuver as it is at times hard to turn with all 3 given weight etc-
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's too big, too heavy, and difficult to ...
customer_reviews.text: It's too big, too heavy, and difficult to maneuver. For the price, it should be much easier to push around. We have a minivan and it just barely fits in the trunk area. We actually bent the wheel a bit trying to fit it in the car. We choose to push two strollers while out and about or to push our double umbrella and wear the third baby.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica T

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Great for kids three and under. Folds great and is easy to understand on seting up different ways. But it is long, so hard to turn quickly. Always goes to the left when trying to steer straight
customer_reviews.author: shaleece and mike

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: We love this stroller! It’s a bit uncomfortable for our 3 year old to sit on the bench. He looks hunched over. And it’s slightly hard to push when you have 3 kids in it. But overall it gets us out of the house and I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Weaks

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but heavy!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of having three seats because I have a 1, 2 and 4 year old. In theory this stroller is great...but pushing and maneuvering is VERY hard! My husband is 6”8 big man and complained how hard it was. The wheels are also very cheap. I’m thinking of trying to return it because we are back to using our jogger. Other then the push problem all the kids had seats and it looks pretty cool. Oh also you really need a large trunk to fit it LARGE! There aren’t really options in the 3 seat space so if your inclined to try it like me, go for it but get ready to struggle with it all day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too big to pick up
customer_reviews.text: The thing is so big no pregnant woman xan pick it up its so huge it wont fit in my car properly i have NO WAY TO BRING IT TO UPS AND I WAS TOLD UPS WPULD PI K IT UP THEY HAVE NOT COME TO PICK IT UP EITHER I WILL NEVER ORDER THIS AGAIN WAS NOT WORTH 300$ WHEN I CAN NOT EVEN PICK IT UP AND IT WONT FIT IN MY TRUCK
customer_reviews.author: Jessika Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Worthless!
customer_reviews.text: So difficult to push and impossible to turn (even slightly) on neighborhood streets. Don’t even think about pushing up a driveway, the wheels will give out on you.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my grandchildren.
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for my three grandchildren. I can't wait until the spring to use it. Update: All three of my grandchildren fit with the extra rear seat. It's easy to maneuver and they were comfortable. It's pretty big. I have a Chevy Traverse. It fits with the 3rd row seats down. It's light enough for me to tie to the roof when all the seats are full.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Feliciano

customer_reviews.title: Hands down best 3 seater stroller!
customer_reviews.text: We love love love this! I have a 3 year old, 2 year old, and 6 month old. It is a bit large but fits easily in the back of my Toyota RAV4. Also it’s very easy to handle. I purchased the extra seat for the back as well as the parent organizer.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Keese

customer_reviews.title: ITS HUGE BUT WORTH IT
customer_reviews.text: Its definitely a big difference if you have two kids and planning on a third i totally recommend it rather than having a single stroller and a double stroller. Its easy to use Only thing i would change is more basket space but still its an amazing stroller to take along anywhere
customer_reviews.author: Salma

customer_reviews.title: Awkward and hard to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: We ended up returning this item. It was just way to big for our kids. It was hard to push and super hard to turn. Just didn’t fit all our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jess5

customer_reviews.title: Pick up truck or suburban needed
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy. Instructions could be a little vague. It's way too big though. I have a Buick Enclave and it does not fit unless I lay down the rear seats. Had problems with the wheels and the brake so I ended up sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C

customer_reviews.title: Stroller is great in distribution and features
customer_reviews.text: Stroller is great in distribution and features, but as soon as its loaded with the kids it becomes super uncomfortable to turn and maneuver with it, requiring a lot of strain and strength to turn,...
customer_reviews.author: JuanMa

customer_reviews.title: Decent stroller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for a 4 yr old, 2 yr old, and 6 week to get around at fairs and water parks. It has great storage and lots of room for the kids. It is hard to turn the stroller when all the kids are in it. It folds up easily but is super long. I took my husband’s truck to haul it because unsure if it will fit in my SUV. I was really hoping it would have been a little bit better from the reviews I read from others.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Coakley

customer_reviews.title: Cost meets the quality.
customer_reviews.text: Like it but didn't seem as sturdy as I would like. Pulling the trays/car seat off can be a pain. I needed for three children one of which has cerebral palsy... Will grow out of it and I will still need and stroller to carry three children.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stroller for multiples!
customer_reviews.text: I got this stroller for my daughter who just had twins and has a 2 1/2 yr old. She loves to be able to take all 3 kiddos in one stroller! It can grow as the kids do. It will last several years for her & she's a very busy mama! The 1 issue is a pretty big one....measure your vehicle before you order & make sure it will fit! This is VERY LARGE, whether open or folded up!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Turning this beast isnt easy when its weighed down with 3 kids but I guess that's what to expect when it's 100lbs of rascal-ness! I love that the basket comes out for easy cleaning
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very big
customer_reviews.text: If only the seats were a little bit longer because it seems like my toddler is sitting on a very small ledge. It takes up a lot of room, so my van and a truck can probably fit it but if u own a small car I don't believe its gonna fit in there.
customer_reviews.author: Pao

customer_reviews.title: And the kid in the back is not comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: It’s HUGE! Can not fit it in the back of the car with out a hassle. I knew it would be big, that’s why we bought it! BUT it’s SO long! And the kid in the back is not comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son and daughter in law. They have six month old twins, and a two year old. They absolutely love it. And the two yr loves riding on the back. I did a lot of research, and even pointed out some others .....this was the one for them.
customer_reviews.author: DLC_Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Great but huge
customer_reviews.text: Definitely measure your vehicle before you buy this! It’s a great stroller but really big!
customer_reviews.author: Jessy and Walter

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I have found for 3 kids
customer_reviews.text: Everything that is promised is delivered with this stroller. I am not saying that my 3.7 year old enjoys standing and hanging on, but she can also sit if she wants to . Best thing I have found for 3 kids.
customer_reviews.author: Ferne F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking and traveling
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grand children, 3 of them. It has served the purpose for walking and traveling
customer_reviews.author: TheSipp

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to maneuver at all
customer_reviews.text: Lots of space but dont think you can turn its hell trying to maneuver at all I hate it
customer_reviews.author: laine

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty quality and using for vacation with foster children
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: MASSIVE
customer_reviews.text: Need a mini van to haul it. No way it will fit into a mid sized SUV. probably going to have to return it . It's easily as long as my couch.
customer_reviews.author: Outnumberedmom

customer_reviews.title: ... 3 kids this stroller makes walks at the park easy and fun
customer_reviews.text: With 3 kids this stroller makes walks at the park easy and fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kathi

customer_reviews.title: CHEAPEST PRICE ON AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: love that fact my 3 children UNDER 3 years old fit all in 1. i did purchase a joovy rear sest for my toddler instead of standing though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Written review
customer_reviews.text: The front tray lock plastic piece was damaged right side was crack in half wear you put the car seat and tray on
customer_reviews.author: Britteny Ellingson

customer_reviews.title: Steers horribly, a wheel broke without more then a few ...
customer_reviews.text: Steers horribly, a wheel broke without more then a few uses and totally NOT WORTH the price. Returned and will get a better product from a new company
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful but a little to big
customer_reviews.text: It’s really really nice no hassle to fold but I have a windstar ford and it doesn’t fit in the back so it’s a little Annoying to put it in my car but other then that it’s great for my little ones.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Quality is excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Very long so may not fit in all vehicles but this is a well built and comfortable stroller!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Moore

customer_reviews.title: It sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly it sucks! It’s very hard to maneuver through isles, and the seats done recline Back at all! And the toddler seat doesn’t stay pushed up, it pushes back which makes it impossible for my little to sit!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to move
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to move and rotate when having more than one child which the purpose of this stroller. I wish I could return it but I bought it before I had my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed Almosawi

customer_reviews.title: hard to push
customer_reviews.text: i loved the color and the look of it. the cupholders and trays are very nice. very difficult to push on sidewalk, it is probably much better on a flat surface like in a store or mall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and we love it.
customer_reviews.text: I get stares lol but hey I have three babies. Heavy duty and we love it.
customer_reviews.author: HappyMamaTo6

customer_reviews.title: Sit/stand portion is not big enough
customer_reviews.text: Hard to push and the sit stand part is almost unusable because the seat slides and does not provide adequate room for third child to sit comfortably or safely. Needs bigger wheels
customer_reviews.author: Rachel jimenez

customer_reviews.title: They are thankful and will enjoy it.
customer_reviews.text: Gift. They are thankful and will enjoy it ..It is very big and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Sue Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Good & Bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as we were expecting twins. They are now 10 months old. We also have a bow 3 year old. This stroller has been great because it has a place for my older child and gets through doorways BUT.... it is not easy to turn. I cannot really go for walks with it because and uneven-ness in the pavement and the stroller will lean that way. I'm constantly fighting to keep it straight. Turning is very difficult too. The padding on the handlebar inexplicably ripped on me too I'm also a little disappointed to see it costing over $100 less now than what I paid for it. Feeling a bit ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Meg

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that i dont like about joovy is that never got a car seat of the same color as the stroller
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Love the Color
customer_reviews.text: Love the Color! Can't wait to use when my twins come this summer. It is VERY long which could be an issue if you don't have a large trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for 3 little ones. I have a hard time fitting it in my dodge minivan but love that I can easily travel with my babies.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherF

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: its a little too big long to steer, but great space between each seat.
customer_reviews.author: yessi lara

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller. I have twins & a 3 year old.
customer_reviews.author: michelle gianoni

customer_reviews.title: So so stroller
customer_reviews.text: I like the color and the fact that it's not too heavy but it is hard to steer and control.. the footrests are short as well..wish they were longer to accommodate my two and a half year old.. I purchased because I have three young ones and needed something ...it definitely works but not a favorite..just okay..gets the job done..I prefer my husband to push it ..too hard for me.
customer_reviews.author: Greeneyedragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Never leave kids unattended
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my daughter to use with my Grandkids
customer_reviews.author: Mariegrein

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR 2 or 3 SMALL CHILDREN
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my newborn twin grandsons. I had to buy them new car seats as well because the ones received at the shower were not compatible. Joovy has a car seat compatibility list on their website that was very helpful as are there service representatives. 2 universal car seat adapters come with it. It's the width of a single stroller just longer. My son and daughter-in-law are very pleased with it because there's a place for my 3 year old grandson to stand or sit on the back. I can see the twins using this until they are 4 or 5 years old.
customer_reviews.author: BTD6555

customer_reviews.title: This stroller is HUGE!!! I MEAN HUGE ...
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is HUGE!!! I MEAN HUGE!!! But so helpful for a mom of 2 toddlers and an infant.
customer_reviews.author: 👑

customer_reviews.title: ... and doesn't fit in my Honda Pilot so it's useless since I can't take it any where so upset ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would've read the reviews it's huge and doesn't fit in my Honda Pilot so it's useless since I can't take it any where so upset I can't get my money back and have to buy a smaller one so it's $300 down the drain...
customer_reviews.author: EdualynAndJuan

customer_reviews.title: HUGE
customer_reviews.text: I mean it it doesn't fit in elevators and just to move it around it's a mess
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller but difficult to turn at times
customer_reviews.text: We have only used this stroller once and not with all three kids yet. We love the way it folds and how well it has a place for each child. Only thing we noticed is that because it's such a long tandem stroller it doesn't turn very well. We took it to Disneyland so you know, large crowds some tight spaces. You need to make some sharp turns there sometimes in a little amount of space but we could only make wide turns with the stroller. We're keeping it because the features we do like out way what we don't. But just good to know for future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, crappy instructions
customer_reviews.text: It does it job for sure. When folded it is long so make sure you have space for this guy. Folds easily. It is a bit heavy. Moms of c-sections especially may need help lifting for a while. (Picture includes separately purchased car seats. Not included) The instructions leave much to figure out on your own, No words just black and white pictures, quite aggravating. So if you have no experience with putting something like this together it will be much worse for you.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Ray Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like the stroller but I am dissapointed at the fact that i bearly reclines
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Joovy Big Caboose Graphite Triple Stroller, Stand on Tandem, Turquoise
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe Joovy Big Caboose Graphite Stand-On Triple Stroller makes it possible to stroll with three young children. The Big Caboose Graphite includes two full-size seats with ample legroom, removable canopies, two child trays and two universal car seat adapters. Both front seats have a 2-position recline and an adjustable footrest. The rear bench seat and standing platform empowers the older child to sit, stand or walk alongside the stroller. A new larger rear canopy provides coverage for the older child when sitting on the rear bench seat. If all three children are close in age or you have triplets, the optional Joovy Caboose Rear Seat accessory can be purchased to convert the stroller's rear bench seat into a full-size reclining seat. It installs easily over the existing rear bench seat to give you three full-size reclining seats with 5-point harnesses. The Big Caboose Graphite can carry up to 125 lbs. so it takes a bit of strength to push and maneuver the stroller when fully loaded. It features sealed-bearings in all the wheels to make pushing and steering the easiest it can be and a linked parking break. All-wheel suspension provides a smooth ride for passengers and the stroller's narrow width makes it easy to go through doorways, hallways and store aisles. When folded, the Big Caboose Graphite measures 14H x 21.5W x 63L inches long (or 54 inches long without the front canopy and tray) so you need a large vehicle to transport this stroller. However, it is remarkably lightweight at only 32.3 lbs.
feature_bullets: Two front seats accommodate children 6+ months and up to 40 lbs, or from birth+ with car seat adapters (included)
Rear bench seat and standing platform accommodates a child from 2.5+ years and up to 45 lbs
Great for twins, twins + toddler, triplets, or three young children, max weight 125 lbs. Material is 300D polyester
Front seats with two-position recline, adjustable footrests, two child trays and two car seat adapters ; Material: 300D Polyester
Linked parking brake and large storage basket, stroller weighs 32.3 lbs ; Folded dimensions: 63” L x 21.5” W x 14” H
